info.name: v1: Magnet Customer API
info.description:
Acesse agora a **documenta√ß√£o oficial da API da Magnet Customer** e descubra como integrar facilmente o seu sistema com uma das plataformas de CRM mais completas do mercado.

Nossa API RESTful foi desenvolvida para oferecer **flexibilidade, seguran√ßa e alto desempenho**, permitindo que desenvolvedores criem integra√ß√µes personalizadas, automatizem processos e conectem dados de forma eficiente.

### O que voc√™ encontra na documenta√ß√£o:

- üìå Autentica√ß√£o via OAuth2
    
- üîÑ Endpoints completos para gerenciamento de tickets, tarefas, contatos, comunica√ß√µes e muito mais
    
- ‚öôÔ∏è Exemplos pr√°ticos em cURL e outras linguagens
    
- üìà Webhooks e eventos para sincroniza√ß√£o em tempo real
    
- üí¨ Suporte a filtros, pagina√ß√£o e ordena√ß√£o
    
- üîê Pr√°ticas recomendadas de seguran√ßa
    

### Por que usar a API da Magnet Customer?

- Integra√ß√£o com ferramentas como **Zapier** e **n8n**
    
- Redu√ß√£o de trabalho manual com automa√ß√µes inteligentes
    
- Integra√ß√£o r√°pida com ERPs, plataformas de e-commerce e outros CRMs
    
- Melhoria da experi√™ncia do cliente com dados atualizados e conectados
    

E se quiser ir al√©m, d√° uma olhada nas integra√ß√µes que j√° est√£o prontinhas pra voc√™:

‚ö° **Zapier**  
[https://zapier.com/developer/public-invite/167012/6c170c0256d308c441a5e857c474d7cd](https://zapier.com/developer/public-invite/167012/6c170c0256d308c441a5e857c474d7cd)

‚öôÔ∏è **n8n**  
[https://www.npmjs.com/package/@magnetcustomer/n8n-nodes-magnetcustomer](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@magnetcustomer/n8n-nodes-magnetcustomer)

item.name: Guides

request.description:
### Request

This endpoint makes an HTTP POST request to `{{auth_url}}/protocol/openid-connect/token` to obtain an access token.

#### Request Body

- `grant_type` (text): The type of grant requested.
    
- `client_id` (text): The client identifier.
    
- `username` (text): The username for authentication.
    
- `password` (text): The password for authentication.
    

### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "access_token": "",
    "expires_in": 0,
    "refresh_expires_in": 0,
    "refresh_token": "",
    "token_type": "",
    "not-before-policy": 0,
    "session_state": "",
    "scope": ""
}

 ```

response.name: Successful OAuth Username Password Login
response.body:
{
    "access_token": "ACCESS_TOKEN_GOES_HERE",
    "expires_in": 900,
    "refresh_expires_in": 86400,
    "refresh_token": "REFRESH_TOKEN_GOES_HERE",
    "token_type": "Bearer",
    "not-before-policy": 0,
    "session_state": "SESSION_GOES_HERE",
    "scope": "openid profile email"
}

request.description:
# OpenID Connect Token Request

This endpoint is used to obtain an access token by presenting an authorization grant.

## Request Body

- `grant_type` (text): The type of grant being used for authentication.
    
- `client_id` (text): The identifier for the client application.
    
- `client_secret` (text): The secret key of the client application.
    

## Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "access_token": "",
    "expires_in": 0,
    "refresh_expires_in": 0,
    "token_type": "",
    "not-before-policy": 0,
    "scope": ""
}

 ```

- `access_token` (string): The access token to be used for accessing protected resources.
    
- `expires_in` (number): The duration in seconds for which the access token is valid.
    
- `refresh_expires_in` (number): The duration in seconds for which the refresh token is valid.
    
- `token_type` (string): The type of token issued.
    
- `not-before-policy` (number): The time before which the token should not be used.
    
- `scope` (string): The scope of the access request.

request.description:
### Request Description

This endpoint is used to obtain an access token by exchanging a refresh token for the specified client.

#### Request Body Parameters

- `grant_type` (text): The type of grant being requested.
    
- `client_id` (text): The identifier of the client making the request.
    
- `client_secret` (text): The secret key of the client making the request.
    
- `refresh_token` (text): The refresh token obtained during a previous authorization.
    

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `access_token` (string): The access token to be used for accessing protected resources.
    
- `expires_in` (number): The duration in seconds for which the access token is valid.
    
- `refresh_expires_in` (number): The duration in seconds for which the refresh token is valid.
    
- `refresh_token` (string): The new refresh token to be used for obtaining a new access token.
    
- `token_type` (string): The type of token returned.
    
- `not-before-policy` (number): The time before which the token cannot be used.
    
- `session_state` (string): The session state.
    
- `scope` (string): The scope of the access token.

response.name: Successful Refresh Token
response.body:
{
    "access_token": "ACCESS_TOKEN_GOES_HERE",
    "expires_in": 900,
    "refresh_expires_in": 86400,
    "refresh_token": "REFRESH_TOKEN_GOES_HERE",
    "token_type": "Bearer",
    "not-before-policy": 0,
    "session_state": "SESSION_GOES_HERE",
    "scope": "openid profile email"
}

urlencoded.description: If an access token is included, Magnet Customer invalidates it and revokes the token. If a refresh token is included, Magnet Customer revokes it and any associated access tokens.

request.description:
### Revoke Access Token or Refresh Token

This endpoint is used to revoke an access token or a refresh token.

#### Request Body Parameters

- `token` (text): If an access token is included, Magnet Customer invalidates it and revokes the token. If a refresh token is included, Magnet Customer revokes it and any associated access tokens.
    
- `client_id` (text): The ID of the client.
    

#### Response

The response will indicate the success or failure of the token revocation request.

urlencoded.description: If an access token is included, Magnet Customer invalidates it and revokes the token. If a refresh token is included, Magnet Customer revokes it and any associated access tokens.

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve user information from the OpenID Connect protocol. The request does not include a request body, as it is a GET request.

### Response

The response will include the following user information:

- `sub` (subject): The unique identifier for the user.
    
- `email_verified`: A boolean value indicating whether the user's email has been verified.
    
- `name`: The full name of the user.
    
- `preferred_username`: The preferred username of the user.
    
- `given_name`: The given name (first name) of the user.
    
- `locale`: The locale of the user.
    
- `family_name`: The family name (last name) of the user.
    
- `email`: The email address of the user.

response.name: Successful User Info
response.body:
{
    "sub": "747ec9f5-c2d3-4ab9-9e22-2b771abe4a07",
    "email_verified": true,
    "name": "<name>",
    "preferred_username": "<username>",
    "given_name": "<name>",
    "locale": "pt-BR",
    "family_name": "<name>",
    "email": "<email>"
}

The endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the OpenID configuration. The response to this request contains various endpoints and supported features related to the OpenID Connect protocol. Below is the JSON schema for the response:

item.description:
# Primeiros Passos

Este guia ir√° ajud√°-lo a come√ßar a utilizar a API da Magnet rapidamente. Siga estas etapas para configurar sua integra√ß√£o e fazer suas primeiras requisi√ß√µes.

## Pr√©-requisitos

Antes de come√ßar, voc√™ precisar√°:

1. Uma conta ativa na plataforma Magnet
    
2. Permiss√µes de administrador para gerar credenciais de API
    
3. Conhecimento b√°sico de REST APIs
    

## Passo 1: Criar uma Aplica√ß√£o

1. Fa√ßa login na sua conta Magnet Customer em [https://magnetcustomer.net](https://magnetcustomer.net) e acesse sua plataforma.
    
2. Navegue at√© **Configura√ß√µes > Integra√ß√µes > API Magnet Customer**
    
3. Clique em **Novo Oauth2.0**
    
4. Preencha as informa√ß√µes:
    
    - Nome da aplica√ß√£o (ex: "Minha Integra√ß√£o CRM")
        
    - Descri√ß√£o (opcional)
        
    - ClientID
        
5. Clique em **Criar Aplica√ß√£o**
    

## Passo 2: Obter Credenciais

Ap√≥s criar a aplica√ß√£o, voc√™ receber√°:

- **Client ID**: identificador p√∫blico da sua aplica√ß√£o
    
- **Client Secret**: segredo da aplica√ß√£o (mantenha-o seguro!)
    

Estas credenciais ser√£o utilizadas para autenticar suas requisi√ß√µes √† API.

item.name: Resources
Contacts

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

item.name: Prospects

request.description:
# Get Prospects

This endpoint retrieves a list of prospects with optional filtering and pagination.

## Request

### Query Parameters

- `page` (number, optional): The page number to retrieve.
    
- `search` (string, optional): Search term to filter prospects.
    
- `limit` (number, optional): The maximum number of prospects to retrieve per page.
    
- `emailsEmpty` (boolean, optional): Filter prospects with empty email addresses.
    
- `phonesEmpty` (boolean, optional): Filter prospects with empty phone numbers.
    
- `interactionsEmpty` (boolean, optional): Filter prospects with no interactions.
    
- `sortBy` (string, optional): Field to sort the prospects by.
    
- `sortType` (string, optional): Sort order (asc or desc).
    

### Response

The response will contain an array of prospect objects with the following fields:

- `_id` (string): Prospect ID
    
- `customFields` (array): Custom fields associated with the prospect
    
- `lifeCycle` (string): Current lifecycle stage of the prospect
    
- `labels` (array): Labels associated with the prospect
    
- `source` (string): Source of the prospect
    
- `name` (string): First name of the prospect
    
- `lastname` (string): Last name of the prospect
    
- `fullname` (string): Full name of the prospect
    
- `age` (number): Age of the prospect
    
- `doc` (string): Document associated with the prospect
    
- `type` (string): Type of the prospect
    
- `phones` (array): Array of phone numbers associated with the prospect
    
- `addressNumber` (string): Address number of the prospect
    
- `relationshipRulerStatus` (boolean): Status of the relationship ruler
    
- `favoriteChannelToCommunication` (array): Favorite communication channels of the prospect
    
- `owners` (array): Owners of the prospect
    
- `participants` (array): Participants associated with the prospect
    
- `observers` (array): Observers associated with the prospect
    
- `interactions` (number): Number of interactions with the prospect
    
- `createdBy` (string): User who created the prospect
    
- `updatedBy` (string): User who last updated the prospect
    
- `createdAt` (string): Timestamp of creation
    
- `updatedAt` (string): Timestamp of last update
    
- `__v` (number): Version number
    

The response also includes pagination information:

- `total` (number): Total number of prospects
    
- `limit` (number): Limit of prospects per page
    
- `page` (number): Current page number
    
- `pages` (number): Total number of pages
    
- `pagingCounter` (number): Counter for the current page
    
- `hasPrevPage` (boolean): Indicates if there is a previous page
    
- `hasNextPage` (boolean): Indicates if there is a next page
    
- `prevPage` (number): Previous page number
    
- `nextPage` (number): Next page number

request.description:
The endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve organizations from the platform API. The request includes query parameters for page number, search, limit, empty emails, empty phones, empty interactions, sort by email, and sort type.

### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following structure:

- `docs` (array): An array of organization documents, each containing various properties such as `_id`, `customFields`, `labels`, `source`, `fullname`, `doc`, `age`, `phones`, `addressNumber`, `owners`, `interactions`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`, `active`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, `__v`, `normalizedName`, and `contacts`.
    
- `total` (number): Total number of organizations.
    
- `limit` (number): Limit of organizations per page.
    
- `page` (number): Current page number.
    
- `pages` (number): Total number of pages.
    
- `pagingCounter` (number): Counter for the current page of results.
    
- `hasPrevPage` (boolean): Indicates if there is a previous page.
    
- `hasNextPage` (boolean): Indicates if there is a next page.
    
- `prevPage` (null or number): Previous page number, or null if there is no previous page.
    
- `nextPage` (null or number): Next page number, or null if there is no next page.
    

The user has requested to document the response of this request as a JSON schema.

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

item.name: Deals

request.description:
### GET /api/deals

This endpoint retrieves a list of deals with optional pagination and filtering.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://{{PLATFORM_SUB_DOMAIN}}.platform-api.magnetcustomer.com/api/deals`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (optional): The page number for pagination (default: 1)
        
    - search (optional): Search keyword
        
    - limit (optional): The maximum number of deals per page (default: 15)
        
    - emailsEmpty (optional): Filter deals with empty emails
        
    - phonesEmpty (optional): Filter deals with empty phone numbers
        
    - interactionsEmpty (optional): Filter deals with empty interactions
        
    - sortBy (optional): Sort the deals by a specific field (e.g., email)
        
    - sortType (optional): Sort type (e.g., desc)

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.

item.name: Pipelines

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve pipelines from the platform. The request includes query parameters for page number, search, limit, and filtering options for empty emails, phones, and interactions, along with sorting parameters.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://{{PLATFORM_SUB_DOMAIN}}.platform-api.magnetcustomer.com/api/pipelines`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number): The page number to retrieve
        
    - search (string): Search query
        
    - limit (number): Number of items per page
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty emails
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty phones
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty interactions
        
    - sortBy (string): Field to sort by
        
    - sortType (string): Sorting order (asc/desc)
        

### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "docs": \[ { "_id": "", "active": true, "defaultView": true, "title": "", "branch": "", "partner": "", "staff": "", "createdAt": "", "updatedAt": "", "__v": 0, "forModel": "", "roles": \[""\], "staffs": \[\], "id": "" } \], "total": 0, "limit": 0, "page": 0, "pages": 0}

### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

request.description:
### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://{{PLATFORM_SUB_DOMAIN}}.platform-api.magnetcustomer.com/api/tasks`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number): The page number to retrieve
        
    - search (string): Search query
        
    - limit (number): Number of items per page
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty emails
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty phones
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty interactions
        
    - sortBy (string): Field to sort by
        
    - sortType (string): Sorting order (asc/desc)
        

### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://{{PLATFORM_SUB_DOMAIN}}.platform-api.magnetcustomer.com/api/meetings`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number): The page number to retrieve
        
    - search (string): Search query
        
    - limit (number): Number of items per page
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty emails
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty phones
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean): Filter for empty interactions
        
    - sortBy (string): Field to sort by
        
    - sortType (string): Sorting order (asc/desc)
        

### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

The response body contains an array of "docs" which includes meeting details such as "_id", "calendar", "staff", "participants", "observers", "title", "description", "start", "end", "status", "contact", "deal", "active", "createdAt", and "updatedAt". Additionally, the response includes "total", "limit", "page", "pages", "pagingCounter", "hasPrevPage", "hasNextPage", "prevPage", and "nextPage" properties.

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

request.description:
The API returns a JSON response with an array of "docs" containing ticket information. Each ticket object includes various fields such as "_id", "customFields", "code", "senderModel", "sender", "workspaceReceiver", "participants", "observers", "subject", "description", "status", "labels", "priority", "active", "contact", "createdAt", "updatedAt", "receiver", "startAt", and "sortPriority". Additionally, the response includes "total", "limit", "page", "pages", "pagingCounter", "hasPrevPage", "hasNextPage", "prevPage", and "nextPage" fields to handle pagination.

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

request.description:
### Get Contacts

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contacts with optional pagination and filtering parameters.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{platform_url}}/contacts`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number, optional): The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string, optional): Search query for filtering contacts.
        
    - limit (number, optional): The maximum number of contacts to retrieve per page.
        
    - emailsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty email addresses.
        
    - phonesEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty phone numbers.
        
    - interactionsEmpty (boolean, optional): Indicates whether to include contacts with empty interaction records.
        
    - sortBy (string, optional): The field to sort the contacts by.
        
    - sortType (string, optional): The type of sorting (e.g., asc for ascending, desc for descending).
        

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object representing the list of contacts, following the specified pagination and filtering criteria.

For the response schema, please refer to the JSON schema provided separately.

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of roles from the platform. The request includes query parameters for pagination, such as page number and limit.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://{{PLATFORM_SUB_DOMAIN}}.platform-api.magnetcustomer.com/api/roles`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - page (number) - The page number for pagination.
        
    - search (string) - Optional search query.
        
    - limit (number) - The maximum number of roles to be returned.
        

### Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following structure:

``` json
{
  "docs": [
    {
      "_id": "",
      "permissions": [""],
      "name": "",
      "partner": "",
      "__v": 0,
      "createdAt": "",
      "updatedAt": "",
      "id": ""
    }
  ],
  "total": 0,
  "limit": 0,
  "page": 0,
  "pages": 0
}

 ```

The `docs` array contains the list of roles with their respective details, such as ID, permissions, name, partner, and timestamps. The `total`, `limit`, `page`, and `pages` fields provide pagination information.

Example Response:

``` json
{
  "docs": [
    {
      "_id": "",
      "customFields": [],
      "fullname": "",
      "email": "",
      "workspaces": [],
      "role": {
        "_id": "",
        "name": "",
        "__v": 0,
        "admin": true,
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": ""
      },
      "status": "",
      "active": true,
      "createdAt": "",
      "updatedAt": "",
      "name": "",
      "lastname": "",
      "__v": 0,
      "lastLogin": "",
      "settings": {
        "sidebarCollapsed": true,
        "theme": ""
      },
      "id": ""
    }
  ],
  "total": 0,
  "limit": 0,
  "page": 0,
  "pages": 0
}

 ```

The example response demonstrates the structure of the `docs` array with role details, including custom fields, user information, role attributes, and settings.
